intro: Lobelia molleri var. butaguensis, commonly known as the Butagué lobelia, is a striking herbaceous plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of vivid blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a textured appearance. This species thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and specialized horticulture.
